reviews.review_msg: Unlike most people I really didn't like Nicole as a prof. I also took BISC300 with her and both classes turned out to be some of my most boring. She often answers questions with "I don't know" and makes many mistakes which she then giggles about. Her facts are based upon Wikipedia and she acts like she is a student - not a professor.

He's fine. He has a very particular way of talking that makes him seem like a jerk. He talks about himself a lot and how cool he is, the work he does etc. and seems like he would much rather be doing conservation work rather than teaching a class. Knows what he is talking about and his material is well taught but, prepare to feel talked down to.

He can still be snarky in his email replies if he thinks your question is obvious so I wouldn't disregard the previous low ratings. However, his lectures were good and he did seem passionate about the course and wanted us to learn things. There's just a lot of things you're graded on which gets pretty tedious so I didn't like the course very much.

Dr. Dulvy has done lots of interesting work in conservation and is a great professor. Lectures were engaging and not stressful, and Dr. Dulvy encouraged interaction and questions. He has been very accommodating regarding the pandemic, offering lots of options for lectures. Assessments were open-book and fairly straightforward.

Genuinely confused over all the bad reviews. Nick is, by far, one of my favourite professors Ive ever had. Lectures are thorough and he frequently stops to ask if its clear. His lectures are enjoyable and most of all, hes very good at getting back to emails at a timely manner and explaining anything we are confused about. I definitely recommend!

Cant really believe he is still a professor, he barely taught the course material, rude to students and full of himself. Showed up late to our final exam and cut the time short so no one finished. I was really excited about this course and it was beyond disappointing. Do yourself a favour & skip any of his classes, what waste of time.

Nick is really well known in conservation worldwide, but he's a pretty average professor. Not very organized as a lecturer. He really shines outside of the classroom and when he's leading projects or encouraging his students to get involved. His course isn't hard and his exam style isn't too heavy in terms of studying. Other profs are harder.

Nick was very disrespectful to students. I had office hours with him to discuss my paper and he talked down on me and my intellectual abilities. He did not offer any guidance or help me get on track but was focused on ridiculing me. The course content is interesting but Nick makes me want to drop out. Truly appalled at his behaviour toward students

He didn't show up for the 1st class and we waited 20 min until a student called him to inform him that a full class was waiting. Didn't take 1 min to send out an email to inform us. Relies 100% on the text. Was all over the place about the final, so we couldn't prepare. Exam was shockingly long and impossible to finish. 100% unfair & unrealistic.

Overall the course was mediocre, erring on the side of disappointing, maining due to overly tough essay marking and a serious lack of time for the final exam (who has a 1 1/2 hour final??). His indecisiveness about the final exam format was ridiculous. He originally said he would provide all the qs ahead of time but changed his mind last minute.
Conservation Biology is one of the best classes available in BISC (not that there is a high bar). Dulvy makes it really interesting.
Conservation biology has the potential to be a great course. But it is not due to the truly appalling Prof!

Excellent class, he brought a lot of experience and insight to the lectures. He can be disorganized, but is a fair grader. The final was a little long, but he did account for this and made adjustments. There was also a super great project- the Conservation Action- which was really fun, let you be creative, proactive and work on what interests you.

Great range of assignments. Kept on track with the required textbook while adding real world examples. Great papers for tutorial discussions. Always tried to start the day with some current conservation issues.
Completely unreasonable, mathematically challenged. Worst professor ever.

Always late to class, and takes him forever to return any marks to the student. Final exam was a joke, not enough time for the length of the exam. Not to mention a change of format of the exam at last minute.

Awful prof, totally agree with the other post. His lateness to lectures didn't bother me too much but he is in desperate need of an attitude check. Rude and disrespectful to students. Took what was supposed to be an interesting course into an awful course and subject I never want to think of again. Good riddance.

Late to classes. Takes too long to get back with marks.. Missed 5 hours of lectures and had guest lectures at other times. Decided to mark presentations after class evaluations. Rude to presenters. Asking question called for certain ridicule, as he seemed to talk down to students. Tested on material at times he didn't even seem to understand.. BAD

Great prof, I'd recommend him to anyone interested in ecology. He's friendly, interesting, easy to listen to. He will learn your name! His teaching style takes a bit of getting used to - assignment instructions are a little unclear. Go to the TA for help if you need it.  Fair marker, interesting content, excellent attitude towards students.
